revive.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time
revive.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
revive.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to become healthy and strong again, or to make someone or something healthy and strong again
revive.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The economy is beginning to revive.
an attempt to revive the steel industry
The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
revive.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to produce a play again after it has not been performed for a long time
revive.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: A London theatre has decided to revive the 1950s musical ‘In Town’.
revive.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if a company, the economy etc revives, or if something revives it, it becomes stronger or more active
revive.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Some regions, such as the Northeast, will revive much more slowly than the national economy.
To revive sales, the company has cut prices by as much as 9%.
revive.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to bring something back into existence or popularity again
revive.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The project is to be revived.
